scenes.heading: EXT. CITY CENTRE - NIGHT
scenes.summary: Opening establishing shot of a ruined city with fires, homeless, rubble from collapsed skyscrapers. Title card explains the pandemic and economic collapse backstory.

scenes.heading: EXT. RUDDY & GREENE BUILDING - FRONT - NIGHT
scenes.summary: Exterior of a bullet-scarred 15-story sandstone building with high-end SUVs parked outside.

scenes.heading: EXT. RUDDY & GREENE BUILDING - REAR - NIGHT
scenes.summary: The Mariner arrives in a fish delivery van, storms the building through the back door, fights his way up via elevator, rescues Rose from the top floor.

scenes.heading: INT. RUDDY & GREEN BUILDING - ELEVATOR
scenes.summary: Mariner and Rose ride the elevator down. She discovers skull fragments. He reveals he tracked her via AirTag. Thugs ambush them on floor 12; Mariner fights them off. Rose decides to go up to floor 11 instead of escaping.

scenes.heading: INT. 11TH FLOOR - CONTINUOUS
scenes.summary: Rose and Mariner search for a stairwell through dim corridors. They hide from a passing thug. Mariner has a flashback to his father teaching him to fish.

scenes.heading: BEGIN FLASHBACK: EXT. COASTLINE - DAY - PAST
scenes.summary: Young Mariner and his father in a sailboat. Dad teaches him to cast a line and tells him what a hero is. Warm, golden, idyllic.

scenes.heading: INT. STAIRWELL - CONTINUOUS
scenes.summary: Rose wants to go back up for her purse, which contains a blockchain password to her life savings. Mariner wants to leave and offers to buy a new purse. Rose pleads and heads upstairs; Mariner follows reluctantly.

scenes.heading: INT. 12TH FLOOR STAIRWELL - CONTINUOUS
scenes.summary: Rosco ambushes them at the stairwell door. Mariner subdues him. Rose forces Rosco to explain blockchain at gunpoint. Rosco reveals the stolen amount is $20 million before Mariner knocks him out. Rose admits she stole gang money.

scenes.heading: INT. 13TH FLOOR
scenes.summary: Three thugs (Vinnie, Mikey, Carlos) patrol the corridor discussing cryptocurrency. They hear Mariner and Rose arguing about his code of honor. Confrontation: Mariner shoots Vinnie with a flare gun, then defeats Mikey and Carlos. Rose tends to Mariner's wounds and reveals Vinnie was her ex-boyfriend.

scenes.heading: INT. 15TH FLOOR
scenes.summary: Clean, luxurious floor (Salvatori's office). Mariner forces open a locked door. Rose retrieves her purse. She questions Mariner about their father. Rose reveals their dad didn't die — he abandoned the family and lives in Chimney Bay. Mariner is devastated. Salvatori arrives with thugs and a submachine gun.

scenes.heading: BEGIN FLASHBACK: EXT. BACKYARD - DAY - PAST
scenes.summary: Young Mariner's dad teaches him weightlifting in an idyllic backyard. Encouraging and warm. Dad tells him never to run from a fight.

scenes.heading: EXT. BACKYARD - DAY - (FLASHBACK)
scenes.summary: The true version: the yard is overgrown with weeds and bottles. Dad punches Young Mariner in the face, berates him for being weak, tells him to lift weights. Dad leaves in disgust. The earlier warm memories were Mariner's romanticized versions.

scenes.heading: INT. STAIRWELL - (BACK TO PRESENT)
scenes.summary: Back to the present. Salvatori asks Mariner who he is. Mariner, shattered by the revelations about his father, quietly says he's nobody. Salvatori taunts him about being a hero.

scenes.heading: EXT. COASTLINE - DAY - (FLASHBACK)
scenes.summary: The true version of the fishing memory: Dad is drunk, pissing off the boat. Young Mariner is underdressed and shivering. Dad's 'hero' speech is self-aggrandizing and crude.

scenes.heading: EXT. BACKYARD - DAY - (FLASHBACK)
scenes.summary: Intercut flashback/present. Thugs force Mariner to his knees. Salvatori demands the password at gunpoint. Rose delivers a speech redefining Mariner as a true hero — not because of his father's teachings, but despite them. Mariner clenches his fists, renewed. Cut to black.
